intro: Spergularia sperguloides, commonly known as the narrowleaf sandwort, is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal and arid environments. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers arranged in dense clusters, and its leaves are narrow and linear. It is well adapted to harsh conditions, showing tolerance to salt and drought. Spergularia sperguloides plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes and supporting local insect populations.
